attributes.action: Change the law so that bereaved children get a benefit when a parent dies
attributes.additional_details:
partner has died.
Children themselves have no influence over whether their parents are married or not, so it seems extremely harsh to deprive some of financial support following a parent’s death based on their parents’ marital status.
This is contrary to current understandings of what constitutes a ‘family’ and differs from how cohabitation is interpreted in other Government legislation.
Persons who die still made NI contributions so why does this differ, because of a documentation of marriage.
attributes.background:
Children should recieve a benefit whether the parents are married or not.
